page.title: 10FOOTPATHS AND BRIDLEWAYS
page.content: {RIGHTS OF WAY AROUND DUNSMORE The area can offer may beautiful paths and bridleways walked often by local Ramblers' Ass. to preserve the rights of way. The Upper Inknield Way borders the Chilterns and there is a parallel track at a higher level, presumably for bad weather use, part of which is included in The Ridgeway long distance path, stretching 85mls from Avebury, Wilts to Ivinghoe Beacon, Herts. Backpackers are usualy seen, but the variety of the hill and valley, far views over the Vale of Aylesbury, attract not only the local people but a greater numbers of casual walkers from London and beyond. The criss, crossing waymarked tracks lead through woods and farmland onto Coombe Hill, giving freedom to wander on the grassy summit, and the bridleways give ample off_road riding for local stables.
